ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I learned how to transition my Italian from grammar question and answer focused to an understanding of more complex literature and conversation.

This course had a really even blend of grammar, vocabulary, and culture. There was also plenty of opportunity for casual conversation in Italian, which was a great way to work on conversation skills despite the limitations of online learning.
I gained grammatical and speaking skills in Italian as well as an appreciation for other cultures outside of my own.
Learned a ton of new Italian vocabulary and grammar, as well as general information on Italian history, culture, traditions, etc.
italian speaking, conversation, writing. knowledge of the culture and history of Italy. exposure to italian film, music, and literature.

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: The variation of this course is phenomenal--movies, conversations, short stories, activities, etc. allowed me to really expand my language skills in more than one direction. The only weakness would be the difficulties of online learning which was outside of anyone's control.
Seminar style and having the class everyday helped me learn and feel more comfortable with speaking the language.

Strengths: being able to speak in Italian daily really helped me learn the language quickly. The textbook used works well when explained by the professor.

Weaknesses: towards the end of the class as we finished the textbook, it felt like we didnt have a lot of content to cover.
Fabulous experience. Clear feedback, extensive syllabus that combined grammar, discussion, writing, and culture. Great energy to class, welcoming and accommodating.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: The breakout rooms were wonderful and really allowed me to practice conversational Italian as well as get to know everyone else in my class. The asynchronous activities were also appreciated to break up some of the classes.
breakout rooms were great for getting time to practice with smaller groups.
All succeeded. great community, very welcoming zoom.

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I would. It is a great continuation of Italian that allows for progression while learning about the culture and enjoying each lesson.
Yes, Italian is a fun language and after L2 I really feel like I can go to Italy and be proficient in the language after just two semesters!

If you are interested in learning Italian, I highly recommend this course. To note: because class meets every day of the week, the workload can be relatively high, especially when learning new grammar. Italian is a very fun language to learn, and the Italian department does a ton to help support its students.
YES! Best department Ive had the privilege of learning from, anyone who is interested in taking a foreign language should take Italian.

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
comments: Occasionally we watched movies outside of class.
